DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: SANTOS, F. C.;Santos, Fernando C.;CAVALCANTE, FERNANDO S.;DOS SANTOS, FERNANDO CAVALCANTE

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH: Graduated in full degree in chemistry from the Federal University of Sao Carlos - Brazil, master in atmospheric pollution in the Sao Paulo University Brazil and currently is PhD student of the Earth System Science Center at the National Institute for Space Research - INPE. Has experience in Atmospheric Chemistry, with atmospheric modeling and field measurements, acting on the following topics: air quality, atmospheric modeling and observation, biogenic volatile organic compounds and oxidative capacity of the atmosphere.

ENDERECO-PROFISSIONAL.NOME-ORGAO: Centro de Cincia do Sistema Terrestre

MESTRADO.NOME-AGENCIA: Conselho Nacional de Desenvolvimento Cientfico e Tecnolgico
MESTRADO.TITULO-DA-DISSERTACAO-TESE: Determinao de Compostos Orgnicos no Material Particulado (MP10) Atmosfrico do Estado de So Paulo

DOUTORADO.NOME-AGENCIA: Fundao de Amparo Pesquisa do Estado de So Paulo
DOUTORADO.TITULO-DA-DISSERTACAO-TESE: Study of natural emissions in the region of the Amazon rainforest: oxidative capacity

VINCULOS.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES: Atividades de pesquisa (campo e laboratrio) sobre a avaliao dos efeitos da dragagem de sedimentos no Canal do Porto de Santos (partio, biodisponibilidade, toxicidade de metais, metaides e compostos orgnicos persistentes - HPA, BPC e hidrocarbonetos alifticos).
Desenvolvimento do projeto "Isolamento e Anlise de Biotransformao de Diterpenos Abietanos Feito Pelo Fungo Agaricus Blazei".
Aulas de Qumica ministradas no curso preparatrio para o vestibular oferecido turma de "Pedagogia da Terra", realizado na Universidade Federal de So Carlos.

Curso de "Iniciao ao Laboratrio de Qumica" ministrado para alunos do Ensino Mdio durante o ano letivo de 2006, sendo que no ms de Outubro os resultados foram apresentados no evento "Cincia na Praa", organizado pela Universidade Federal de So Carlos.

Participao no Programa de Aperfeioamento de Ensino - PAE, da Universidade de So Paulo, como estagirio/bolsista na disciplina QFL 3205 - Qumica Ambiental II sob a superviso da Profa. Dra. Liane Mrcia Rossi.

The numerical system CCATT-BRAMS (Coupled Chemistry Aerosol Tracer Transport model coupled to BRAMS) simulates the emission, transport and deposition of gases and aerosols in the atmosphere and is used in the operation of air quality forecast for South America CPTEC / INPE. The incorporation of information about atmospheric chemistry, specifically for secondary aerosols, in the model structure CCATT-BRAMS is essential for the qualitative development of the model. The organic aerosols are formed by direct emissions of primary organic particles and photochemically produced, constituting the secondary organic aerosols (SOA). Despite its abundance in the troposphere and recognized effects on climate and human health, emissions of SOA and its properties remain being misunderstood and poorly represented in models of emissions, transport and deposition of gases and aerosols. Thus, the project aims to investigate the formation of secondary aerosols in order to add such information in the model CCATT-BRAMS. Initially the chemical species will be studied according to their relevance in the formation of secondary aerosol. After this phase, we intend to incorporate the chemical component of secondary aerosols in the model BRAMS CCATT, evaluating their efficiency through comparative testing with actual measurements.
